content.description: Climb the handcrack just left of the chimney flake feature to a ledge and then to the top on easier climbing.
content.location: Right around the corner from Lips & Assholes and Processed Meat.

content.description: Pull over a small roof to start.  Then continue on face climbing on an overhanging right trending flake system.
content.location: Overhanging flake left of an arete.  Left of Lips and Assholes.

content.description: Climb a plated flake and top out with a hand crack
content.protection: As it's name implies, it's a good passive route.  Otherwise small cams with one hand sized to protect the top out, if you wish.  Bolt Anchor
content.location: On the right wall of the corner that's just right of the large Tommy flake

content.description: Nice fingercrack behind tree leads up about 30 feet.  Then, climb a lichen covered lower angled fact to a large tree above.  Would have been better had the crack continued to the top, but you can't always get what you want.
content.location: On the next buttress past Processed Meat, this is a fingercrack right behind a tall skinny cedar tree.

content.description: Big moves on steep orange face.  Not quite as cool as Processed Meat, but you might as well do it while you're there.
content.location: Overhanging face right of Processed Meat, along left side of blunt arete.

climbs.name: Fuzzy Dice
climbs.fa: Tom Carter, Kim Milburn, Francis Connors

content.description:
This vertical to sub-vertical sport climb starts of with easy fifth moves to the first bolt. Small crimping with good feet takes you up the closely spaced first 3 bolts.  

  Immediately after the 3 bolt comes the 1 move crux. Get those feet up, and make a large move to a dirty but good hold! The remainder of this route may be a little dirty but mostly involves moderate and secure climbing past another bolt to the 2 bolt anchor (no rap rings, just hangers).   

  While the guidebook calls this a "convoluted version of Dashboard Jesus" {just left of this route} I found it to be a lot of fun.
content.location: Climb the line of 4 bolts to the left of Processed Meat (on the left side of the dihedral).

content.description: A quality, slightly overhanging arête feature, naturally sweetened by a healthy runout above the last bolt.

climbs.name: Dashboard Jesus
climbs.fa: Ken Cuddy, Sean Burns and Dick

content.description: On the left side of the dihedral from Processed Meat you'll find 2 bolt lines with a shared first bolt. The left line of glue ins is Dashboard jesus. Make your way up this sustained vertical to sub-vertical face using crimpers and decent feet.
content.location: Left side of the Dihedral found at Processed Meat wall. The first bolt is shared with Fuzzy Dice.

content.description: This short, techy face shares anchors with Fruit Bowl.  Stickclipping the first bolt isn't a bad idea.
A low crux with a thin crack leads to wider and easier climbing. Traverse right anchors
content.protection: Standard Rack. Short traverse to anchors to the right.
content.location: Just left of Processed Meat Wall

content.description: Start behind a cluster of small trees and clip the low first bolt before moving out onto the face.  Work your way up as you discover hidden holds that keep the route a moderate.
content.location: Start just left of the route on the side wall and step over some saplings to get onto the route.

content.description: This is the southmost of the large boulders downhill from Flat Fields.  The climbs (all 2 of them) face south, allowing for some sun warmed rock.
